intro: Lourea pierrei, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a tropical shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its dense, yellowish-green foliage and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant thrives in humid, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Lourea pierrei is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
